name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches
description: These BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches feature a "meaty" mix of jackfruit and chickpeas tossed in spices, garlic, and a bit of BBQ sauce. Pile it all on top of a toasted bun with slaw and dinner is ready!¬†
keywords: bbq jackfruit, jackfruit recipe, vegan sandwich
recipeIngredient: 14-ounce can young jackfruit in brine, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
several good shakes of paprika, chili powder, and onion powder
ideally, a pre-made slaw bag mix!
otherwise: thinly sliced cabbage + mayo, lemon juice or vinegar, sugar and salt
any other toppings you like – I’d recommend avocado, pepperoncini, pickles, hot sauce, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium high heat. Add the jackfruit and break it apart into “shreds” with the back of a spoon.¬†
recipeInstructions.name: Shred the Jackfruit

video.name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches Step 1
video.description: Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium high heat. Add the jackfruit and break it apart into "shreds" with the back of a spoon.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small chopper or food processor, pulse your chickpeas and garlic until they have a finely chopped texture. Add the mixture to the pan, along with the brown sugar and spices. Stir it all up to get it seasoned and happy. Add barbecue sauce and let it get a little roasty. More undisturbed time in the pan = more meat-like browning.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the Filling

video.name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches Step 2
video.description: In a small chopper or food processor, pulse your chickpeas and garlic until they have a finely chopped texture. Add the mixture to the pan, along with the brown sugar and spices. Stir it all up to get it seasoned and happy. Add barbecue sauce and let it get a little roasty. More undisturbed time in the pan = more meat-like browning.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve your jackfruit BBQ on a bun topped with slaw and anything else you like! Add a pile of salt & pepper chips to your plate and you are in delicious business.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble Sandwiches

video.name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches Step 3
video.description: Serve your jackfruit BBQ on a bun topped with slaw and anything else you like! Add a pile of salt & pepper chips to your plate and you are in delicious business.

video.name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches
video.description: These BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches feature a meaty mix of jackfruit and chickpeas tossed in spices, garlic, and a bit of BBQ sauce. Pile it all on top of a toasted bun with slaw and dinner is ready!

review.reviewBody: I am loving this series. I appreciate that you continue to offer the quickest way to get dinner on the table, along with a few options to glam things up.
Only tip would be to double this recipe!!
Made this tonight and everyone enjoyed it!

I will definitely be keeping a couple of cans of jackfruit around to make this again‚Äîprobably doubling it so there are leftovers next time. I had my family dig in before telling them what it was‚Äîmy husband was shocked it was vegetarian and told me to keep it in rotation!

One of my favorite fruits is jackfruit. Sadly, I don't readily get the fresh ones here like I did growing up in the Philippines. But to see that this recipe uses canned? Hmmm......I'm going to have to give this a try! Thanks for the post!

I made this for dinner.  
My hubby and I enjoyed soooooooooo much!
With chickpea, the burger's texture get more real!
And only your recipe put chickpea.  
Thanks for great recipe:)
My skeptical, carnivorous husband loved these!  100% into the rotation of a quick easy dinner.  Yum and give me some more.

I just made this and OMG, it was mind-blowingly delicious. 

Your vegetarian recipes are so creative! Keep them coming! 

(I found canned jackfruit at Trader Joe's after no luck at my usual grocery store!)

Having never tried jackfruit, I was SKEPTICAL. I can say I was very pleasantly surprised! My husband had some as well and without me saying anything, he asked if it was chicken! Ultimately shocked and confused as to how this strange ‚Äúfruit‚Äù can resemble pulled pork. It really was delicious and it almost had an Italian-esque flavor to it. Will be definitely making this again!
I've always tried to like bbq jackfruit but I always felt it was missing something,  now I know it was chickpeas! This recipe is a game changer and will be on rotation all summer long.
First time with jackfruit and we all loved it. The coleslaw is key and the spices you cook it in before adding the bbq sauce are great. I added some heat but this was great. Thx!

I LOVE these BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches - a favorite amongst my family. I always double the recipe and sometimes have leftovers (which reheat nicely in a skillet). A great weeknight meal that is QUICK and so delicious.

Ok‚Ä¶ I was skeptical. My wife was worse. But we‚Äôve both been won over! As my wife said, ‚Äúif you told me it was pulled pork I wouldn‚Äôt have known the difference!!‚Äù  I didn‚Äôt have chickpeas but had some homemade hummus. Used it instead and it was great. Smoked paprika was a big plus also. Thank you for this recipe!!

TLDR; if you actually use the right amount of ingredients, these are so freaking delicious!

I've only ever seen 20 oz cans (10 oz drained). The first time I made these, I thought they were good, not great. I was thinking that I had 10 oz of jackfruit, so about 2/3 of the jackfruit needed for the recipe and under-measured a bit on all the other ingredients. 

This second time, I realized the 14 oz cans are probably 7 oz drained and I actually had more jackfruit than the recipe called for (duh!!). So I used roughly 1.5 20 oz cans and doubled all the other ingredients and they were AMAZING!! I had no trouble finishing the double batch all by myself in a couple days!

I used the leftover jackfruit to make taco "meat" to put in quesadillas, using this recipe https://www.acouplecooks.com/best-jackfruit-tacos/

This recipe is DELICIOUS and one of our new favorite recipes! The jackfruit and chickpeas are the perfect consistency and it is even better with all the suggested toppings! I‚Äôve never cooked with jackfruit until this recipe and it is very easy to work with.  I‚Äôve made it multiple times now. Very good with sweet potato or carrot fries

Hi Lindsay, I follow you on Pinterest and will always choose one of your recipes over others because yours are consistently  good.  I have never had jackfruit before but thought I‚Äôd try this recipe.  It is fantastic!  I served it to my husband for watching the football playoffs and he loved it too.  Thank you for another awesome recipeüòÉ
